Crossing Guard Stacy Walsh shared a great story of kindness from Ward Traditional Academy eighth-grade students!

Last Thursday, WTA eighth-grade students came to drop off their class projects to the school front gate. While they were there, Walsh and Sixth-Eighth-Grade Math Teacher Amanda Roeder had the idea to ask students to leave behind a chalk message for their principal, Dr. Taime Bengochea, who would soon be moving on to another school.

‚ÄúI had a thought... since Dr. Bengochea‚Äôs birthday was on Friday and given the current COVID-19 situation, these kids possibly may not see her again this academic year to say goodbye before they head to high school and before she moves on to Tempe Academy in the fall. We thought it would be great to have students chalk a birthday message, encouraging message, or a drawing in the school bus lane thanking her and uplifting each other during this unsettling time.‚Äù #ChooseKindnessTD3

‚ÄúTeaching my students about the importance of adopting when you are able to properly care for the animal has been a great joy for me," Ms. Christine said. #ChooseKindnessTD3

Day 47 of 180 School Days of Kindness! #ChooseKindnessTD3

Gililland Middle School started a new club this year called SAVE (Students Against Violence Everywhere) Promise Club. During their Start with Hello week, students wrote out ways that they could lend a hand to others, and the SAVE Club helped put them up around the school. We are excited to see how this club positively impacts students!

For more information on SAVE Clubs or Start with Hello, visit sandyhookpromise.org/savepromiseclub.
